Database

Connection

File Description

File to manage all connections and queries made to the MySQL database.

database.connect(host: str = HOST, user: str = USER, password: str = PASSWORD, database: str = DATABASE) → MySQLConnection

Establish a connection with the MySQL database. Used as a wrapper of mysql.connector.connect() to avoid verbose function calls everytime a database is to be connected. Functionally similar to the mentioned function.

Parameters

  • host (str) – Name of the host of the database; optional, defaults to ‘localhost’.

  • user (str) – Name of the user of the database; optional, defaults to ‘root’.

  • password (str) – Password for the database; optional, defaults to the correct password.

  • database (str) – Name of the database to which the connection is made; optional, defaults to ‘health_warehouse_db’.

Returns

Database to which the connection has been established.

Return type

MySQLConnection

database.add_to_database(command: str)

Run a MySQL command on the database to add new data to it. Commits and closes the database after the operation is complete.

Parameters

command (str) – MySQL command to be run on the database.

database.get_from_database(query: str) → list[tuple[Any, ...]]

Run a MySQL query on the database and retrieve all results from it. Closes the database after the operation is complete.

Parameters

query (str) – MySQL query to be run on the database.

Returns

Results of the query from the database. If only one result is retrieved, return type is a singleton list.

Return type

list[tuple[Any, …]]
